data.title: Republican senator criticizes potential dual U.S. antitrust tech probes
data.text: The Republican chairman of the Senate's antitrust panel criticized plans by the Justice Department and Federal Trade Commission to potentially investigate four of the biggest U.S. tech firms.

data.title: Calls to Break Up Big Tech Are Growing
data.text: Concerns about privacy and anticompetitive behavior are incentivizing politicians on both the left and the right to go after the large tech companies that have dominated U.S. consumer life for the past decade.

data.title: NFC gets a lot more powerful in iOS 13

data.title: The trade war is taking a big bite out of profits for Wall Street's biggest names
data.text: Companies that derive more than half their sales outside the U.S. are expected to see a 9.3% slump in earnings in Q2.

data.title: Upside to Tech Breakup?
data.text: Needham's Laura Martin and Pangea Policy's Terry Haines join "Squawk Alley" to discuss the growing scrutiny of big tech companies like Google and Facebook, and why there might be a benefit to their hypothetical break up.

data.title: Google opens its Android security key tech to iPhone and iPad users
data.text: Google will now allow iPhone and iPad owners to use their Android security key to verify sign-ins, the company said Wednesday. Last month, the search and mobile giant said it developed a new Bluetooth-based protocol that will allow modern Android 7.0 devices and later to act as a security key for two-factor authentication.

data.title: States ramp up pressure on federal regulators to rein in big tech
data.text: Attorneys general in several states have already opened or are preparing to launch their own investigations into Facebook, Apple and Google over concerns about privacy and anti-competitive practices.

data.title: iMovie’s big iOS update adds 80 new soundtracks, green screen effects, image overlays
data.text: Ahead of the public launch of Apple’s revamped suite of first-party apps on iOS 13, the company has rolled out a new version of its popular video editor, iMovie for iOS. data.title: Cramer: Apple shares are more likely to get hurt by President Trump than Chinese leader Xi
